events.name: ArtScience on Screen: Wasted! The Story of Food Waste
events.description:
ArtScience on Screen: WASTED! The Story of Food Waste

Can you imagine if every time you opened your wallet, a third of your cash fell out – and you did nothing about it? Consider the fact that one-third of the food grown annually for human consumption is never eaten – for one reason or another, it ends up in the garbage. That’s $218 billion – or 1.3 billion tons – of food annually. In America, families chuck about 25% of the food and beverages they buy at a cost of $1,365 to $2,275 annually. Yet at the same time, 800 million people around the globe are starving. It’s a problem – but one with no shortage of solutions.

The Rockefeller Foundation supported Zero Point Zero Films and Anthony Bourdain to expose the magnitude of this problem globally, while showing simple changes we can all make to eat more and waste less. WASTED! The Story of Food Waste stars chef-heroes like Bourdain, Dan Barber, Mario Batali, Massimo Bottura, and Danny Bowien, and shows how any action -- no matter how small -- can lead to new ways of using more food, feeding more people, curbing environmental damage, stimulating technology and business, and ultimately improving the health and well-being of all citizens worldwide.

WASTED! will showcase forward-thinking organisations and individuals who are already influencing the future of food recovery and demonstrate how eating empowers you, in the fight to solve one of the greatest problems of the 21st Century: GLOBAL FOOD WASTE.

Dates and Screening Times: 
19 – 30 September
at 11am, 12.30pm, 2pm, 3.30pm, 5pm 
Classification: NC16
Running time: 90 minutes
Venue: Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free Admission on a first-come-first-served basis

This programme is screened as part of the Season of Sustainability that runs from August through September. Opening the season is a screening of Otter Town, followed by Sunday Showcase: Sustainable Idealism² with Temasek Polytechnic and the annual Singapore Eco Film Festival. Rounding off the season is the Asian premiere of Wasted! The Story of Food Waste. 

In line with Sands ECO360° Sustainability initiative that strives to minimize our environmental impact, leading the way in sustainable building development and resort operations.  

#ArtScienceonScreen #SandsECO360 #SeasonOfSustainability

events.name: Hack && Tell Singapore at ThoughtWorks!
events.description: Hack && Tell is a show and tell meetup for programmers. Call for speakers is open! Submit your proposals here:  https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1IXU0Oa0waMjB7-_CqL42vrUmASb9UoM_F_y_Gshi9r4/ Check out previous talks for inspiration! --- Worked on a project that you're excited about? Encountered a mysterious bug that got you scratching your head? Or did you just learn how to use a new command line tool that changed your life? Tell us about it! We encourage presentations of any kind on projects that people work on for fun, for the love of all things technical. The only rules are 1) no startup pitches and 2) no work projects (unless it solves a general problem and is open sourced). Talk slots are 10 minutes long (5 minutes of presentation and 5 minutes of Q&A). First-time speakers and of underrepresented groups in tech are welcome! We'd be glad to help you prepare for your talk.  --- Agenda: 6:30p - 7:00p: Dinner (will be provided)7:00p - 8:00p: Lightning Talks 8:00p - 9:00p: Meet the speakers + mingling Food: Food will be provided for dinner. Vegetarian and halal options available. Please let us know if you have any dietary or assistive needs. Getting here: TBA Speakers and their projects:  TBA.See previous speakers' talks here, courtesy of Engineers.sg https://engineers.sg/organization/sg-hack-tell--184
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: Building Native Mobile Apps for iOS, Android and Windows using .NET with Xamarin
events.description: Hi all, We are back, this time let's build NATIVE mobile apps using .NET. Seriously, some developers thinking that creating mobile apps using .NET with Xamarin is not native. Well, they are wrong. They probably also don't know that Xamarin is Open Source. Want to know more on how to build one? Join this meetup. This meetup is for .NET Level 200+, but for Level 100 (beginners) on Xamarin. Wanna join 2 days Global Xamarin Summit in Singapore on September 22~23, 2017 but don't have the ticket? There will be surprises. Only for member who come and join this meetup. ALL who join this meetup. Yes, this meetup also includes how to create Mobile Apps and implementing AI on Azure. Please join. AGENDA "Understanding MVVM on Xamarin Forms" by Riza MarhabanCreate ONE form view that works on iOS, Android and Windows "Real-Time Apps with Xamarin Forms" by Riza MarhabanCan Mobile back end and Xamarin Forms do Real-Time stuff. Yes you can! (backup topic if time permitted) "Building Better Apps with Implementing AI" by Eng Soon Cheah (MVP)Mobile apps without leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI) is just another stupid apps. "IoT with Xamarin.Forms" by Paul Lorett B. AmazonaWho said we cannot do IoT stuff and using Xamarin Forms apps. Other topics by Dawa Law (TBD) and Gog Chun Lin (TBD) Please support and join this community meetup. Don't be lack of expertise in developing mobile apps. You already know .NET, and you can build iOS, Android and Windows mobile apps. Why not use it, show to your friends and boss. Wi-Fi: AvailableFood: Waiting for Sponsor :)Surprises: Available! See you at the venue. Happy coding and Enjoy! Organizers,Riza MarhabanTwitter: @rizamarhaban
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Kotlin language features explained
events.description: Super excited to announce the second meetup of Kotlin User Group Singapore. There will be three talks:  • "Lambda, Closure, Anonymous Function and Where to Find Them" - dive to the most used features of Kotlin.  • "Making Magic with Kotlin Collections" - collections in Kotlin explained and few magic lessons about them. • "Java to Kotlin. Finally, let’s convert!" - the story behind converting large code base from Java to Kotlin. Thanks Grab for being our sponsor for this meetup. Grab is hiring! https://grab.careers/ Agenda: 19:00 - 19:20 Registration and hangout time  19:20 - 19:30 Welcome words  19:30 - 20:00 "Lambda, Closure, Anonymous Function and Where to Find Them" by Andrey Mischenko 20:00 - 20:30 "Making Magic with Kotlin Collections" by Ilya Vorobev  20:30 - 20:45 Refreshment break  20:45 - 21:15 “Java to Kotlin. Finally, let’s convert!” by Ruslan Kim 21:15 - 21:30 - Closing of event
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70, Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117371

events.name: HOW IOT AND EDGE COMPUTING CHALLENGE TODAY’S CENTRALISED DATA CENTER MODEL
events.description: According to forecasts, more than 50 billion IoT devices will be online by 2020. Driven by Big Data, Industry 4.0 and IoT, not only the amount of data but also the demand for fast accessible computing capacity near the data's place of origin will increase. Customers need solutions to analyse more data more quickly and in a cost-effective way. “Edge computing” is the key.  In the edge data centre, customers are able to manage the big data volume and low latency needed for IoT data. The rapidly deployable solution provides an integrated monitoring system control of all IT infrastructure parameters within the edge data centre. This session will review the installation requirements, similar to those for a traditional data centre, but with solutions unique to an edge deployment. Physical protection, environmental and climate control in a secure operational environment can be solved by different housing options, such as stand alone, security room, container. Speakers Mark Roberts, Director Of Marketing & Product Management, Rittal ANZMijee Walker, Asia Pacific Leader (Resiliency Services), IBM Partner Event : http://dcd.events/conferences/singapore-2017  Agenda : http://dcd.events/conferences/singapore-2017/programme  You must register to attend : http://dcd.events/conferences/singapore-2017#tickets  Apex and DataTorrent RTS is being actively used in use cases relating to Big Data, Cloud, IOT, CyberSecurity, Real-Time Anomaly detection, etc. This conf will help us understand how Apex can be used in these use cases. To reduce time to market and total cost of ownership, look at operable solutions factory - that you can quickly import and launch. Examples: HDFS to HDFS & HDFS-Line-Copy (back-up, replication, disaster-recovery, distcp replacement); Kafka  to HDFS (ingest, transform); S3 to HDFS (cloud to on-prem); HDFS to Kafka (data lake to event stream, big data log streaming); Database to HDFS (db offload); Database to Database (change data capture, customer 360); Kafka to Database (ingest, transform & load); Kinesis to S3 (Cloud ingest, transform, & load). Templates include ability to parse, error check, transform, and act on before loading. Additionally, You can add/modify your custom logic on transform, alerts, and actions. Templates include real-time dashboarding for instant views and historical views. Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for qualifying startups. Check it out! Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for Universities. Check it out! Brought to you by DataTorrent, creators of Apache Apex.
events.location: Marina Bay Sands, 10 BAYFRONT AVENUE SINGAPORE 018956, Singapore
events.group_name: Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data Apex Users Group, Singapore
